summary: This FBI document from October 28, 2009, details the opening of an obstruction of justice investigation (72-MM-NEW) against Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. Rodriguez attempted to sell documents related to the civil case against Epstein to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000, despite having been served a federal subpoena to provide them.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, subject of obstruction investigation
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein who, in August 2009, contacted attorney Bradley Edwards and attempted to sell documents pertinent to the civil case against Epstein for $50,000, despite being under a federal subpoena to provide them.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.role: Attorney representing plaintiffs suing Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Attorney representing four female individuals in a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein. He was contacted by Alfredo Rodriguez, deposed him, served him with a federal subpoena, and refused Rodriguez's illegal demand for money in exchange for documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a civil lawsuit brought by four female individuals represented by attorney Bradley Edwards. His former employee, Alfredo Rodriguez, possessed documents related to this case.

connections.description: Rodriguez was an employee for Epstein, as stated in the document.
Edwards is an attorney representing plaintiffs who are suing Jeffrey Epstein in a civil case.
Edwards deposed Rodriguez and served him with a federal subpoena. Rodriguez then attempted to illegally sell documents to Edwards.

events.title: Rodriguez contacts Edwards about selling documents
events.description: On or about August 2009, Alfredo Rodriguez contacted attorney Bradley Edwards and attempted to sell him documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein civil case for $50,000.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction of justice investigation
events.description: The FBI drafts a document to open a new obstruction of justice matter (Case ID 72-MM-NEW) against Alfredo Rodriguez based on his attempt to sell subpoenaed documents.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, attempted to sell documents related to the civil case against Epstein to plaintiff's attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000 in August 2009.
Bradley Edwards had already deposed Rodriguez and served him with a federal subpoena requiring him to provide all relevant documents, making Rodriguez's demand for payment illegal.
The FBI opened a formal obstruction of justice investigation (Case ID 72-MM-NEW) against Alfredo Rodriguez on October 28, 2009, based on this incident.
The document reveals an attempt by an Epstein insider to monetize case documents, potentially obstructing the civil litigation against Epstein.
